discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A beep code is the audio signal from a computer when it first powers on to give the Power-On Self-Test (POST) result. Typically, one short beep means that it passed the test successfully or a series of beeps means that something is wrong with the computer hardware.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator recently upgraded the memory in a server, and now the server does not turn on, and nothing is displayed on the screen. Which of the following is the NEXT step the administrator should take to diagnose the error without opening the machine?
A server administrator wants to check the open ports on a server. Which of the following commands should the administrator use to complete the task?

discussion.content: D is the correct answer. netstat -a will return all the active ports

RAID 10, also known as RAID 1+0, is a data storage technology that combines RAID 1 and RAID 0 to improve data protection and performance. It's a popular choice for high-end computing environments

questions.question_text: An administrator has been asked to deploy a database server that provides the highest performance with fault tolerance. Which of the following RAID levels will fulfill this request?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
P2V stands for "physical to virtual" and is a process that moves a physical computer's operating system, applications, and data to a virtual machine (VM):

questions.question_text: A data center has 4U rack servers that need to be replaced using VMs but without losing any data. Which of the following methods will MOST likely be used to replace these servers?

choices.B: The server has high disk latency.
choices.A: The server has high page utilization.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. The application is single-threaded.

Adding more vCPU cores to a virtual machine may not necessarily improve performance if the application is single-threaded. In a single-threaded application, it can only effectively utilize one CPU core at a time. Even if more vCPUs are added, the application won't be able to take advantage of the additional cores, leading to continued CPU contention.

questions.question_text: An administrator is troubleshooting an application performance issue on a virtual server with two vCPUs. The application performance logs indicate CPU contention. The administrator adds more vCPU cores to the VM, yet the issue persists. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason for this issue?
